org.openadaptor.core.connector
Class AbstractPollingReadConnector

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.core.connector.AbstractPollingReadConnector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IPollingReadConnector, IReadConnector
Direct Known Subclasses:
CronnablePollingReadConnector, DBEventDrivenPollingReadConnector, LoopingPollingReadConnector
public abstract class AbstractPollingReadConnector
extends Component
implements IPollingReadConnector

An abstract implementation of IPollingReadConnector.
Based on the legacy PollingReadConnector. When this connector polls it calls the following on the IReadConnector it is wrapping...

  • IReadConnector.connect()
  • IReadConnector.next(long), until IReadConnector.isDry() returns true
  • IReadConnector.disconnect()

Author:
Fred Perry, Kris Lachor, Eddy Higgins
See Also:
IPollingReadConnector, IReadConnector

Method Detail

connect

public void connect()
Initialises start and reconnect times. Calls connect() on the delegate. Keeps count of the number of calls.

Specified by:
connect in interface IReadConnector

next

public java.lang.Object[] next(long timeoutMs)
                        throws OAException
Fetch next data from delegate, subject to polling conditions.
It will call next(long) on the delegate, but first makes sure the time is right, i.e. we're past the startTime and the delegate isn't dry. If the delegate isreconnectTime the delegate is disconnected and (re)connected again. If the delegate is still dry despite a reconnection, it sleeps for the length of the timeout.

Specified by:
next in interface IReadConnector
Parameters:
timeoutMs - the maximum time in milli-seconds to wait for data is none is available immediately
Returns:
null or an array of data with one or more element.
Throws:
OAException

initTimes

protected void initTimes()
Initialises connect and reconnect times to current time. This method will typically be overridden to init times in a connector specific way.

calculateReconnectTime

protected void calculateReconnectTime()
Recalculates reconnect time but adding DEFAULT_RECONNECT_INTERVAL to the current reconnectTime. This method will typically be overridden to init times in a connector specific way.

isDry

public boolean isDry()
Description copied from interface: IReadConnector
Used to establish whether there is any more data to process. The run implementation of ReadNode returns when this method returns true. The behaviour of the implementation is very much dependent of type of external resource that implementation "talks to", it should only return true if there will never be any more data available, this is different from the scenario where there is is no data at the moment but there maybe in future. The documentation for each implementation should state its specific behaviour.

Specified by:
isDry in interface IReadConnector
Returns:
true if either the delegate is dry or the number of calls to the delegate has exceeded the max limit.
See Also:
IReadConnector.isDry()

setPollLimit

public void setPollLimit(int limit)
Optional. Defaults to 1

Parameters:
limit - the number of polls to perform before exiting the adaptor. A limit of less than 1 indicates an infinte loop and the adaptor will never exit!

getDelegate

public IReadConnector getDelegate()
Description copied from interface: IPollingReadConnector
Returns the underlying read connector for which the polling strategy is defined. The underlying connector can either be a 'concrete' IReadConnector (jms, jdbc, file, ...) or another IPollingReadConnector.

Specified by:
getDelegate in interface IPollingReadConnector
Returns:
the underlying polling read connector.
See Also:
IPollingReadConnector.getDelegate()
